Author: gyro_robo
Content: That's fair enough -- if a language doesn't fit your aesthetic, it's quite a valid reason to use something else.

Author: joseph
Content: I went to a functional programming group meeting and found that the people there used the term hacker with disdain. From the context it seemed like they used it to refer to programmers who don't have graduate degrees.

Author: gyro_robo
Content:
Employees? You want people who do as they're told and accept bureaucracy.

Essentially the opposite of a founder.

Author: szczupak
Content: Danielha NPV, IRR are good measures too, but I think 90% of investors still use ROE, ROI, ROA etc.

Author: gibsonf1
Content: The article seems to be written by a non-native English speaker - full of errors.  I like the idea for the service though, but they didn't even have an entry for my laptop (Dell Inspiron 9400) but served up a lot of adds revolving around it.
